Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen 
today I'm going to show you how to make your

own homemade si Racha hot sauce or as most people 
call it sriracha now some of you may know this

but sriracha the popular one is actually named 
after a town in Thailand called si Racha which

is where this style of hot sauce originated 
and my cousin went to school here so he's

very passionate about it and so I figured out 
how to make it myself and I don't think I will

buy store-bought sriracha again because this is so 
easy and I actually like it better so I'm going

to share this recipe with you let's get started so 
let's talk about what kind of peppers you can use

so the Thai Si Racha they use spiritually so 
pretty fat rooster brand uses red jalapenos you

can use whatever kind of hot peppers that you 
like as long as it's red but you also want to

choose ones that have quite a bit of flesh to 
it because you know we want some pulp at the

end of the day so don't use Thai chilies however 
you can add some Thai chilies if you find that

it's not hot enough for you what I'm using here 
are frozen yours doesn't have to be frozen does

mine happens to be frozen this is actually two 
types of peppers have got some spiritual ease

in here and the rest are called gusto peppers 
which is a local variety that is incredibly hot

unfortunately I accidentally mix them I have no 
idea which is which so I don't know how hot this

is gonna be so we'll find out now some other 
varieties you can choose our serrano peppers

jalapenos as I said and also Fresno chilies 
which are quite widely available when I was

in California I'm going to add some garlic lots 
and lots of garlic and this is going to make

it not just the hot sauce but also a flavorful 
sauce cover this with white vinegar it's going

to take about a cup but really you just want it 
so that it's just submerged alright I'm going to

just let it simmer for about 15 minutes or just 
until the garlic is mushy the chiles are going to

mush pretty fast but you want the garlic to be 
completely soft so when we blend it it doesn't

have that raw garlic flavor and also it's nice and 
smooth but low simmer we're not boiling everything

away here so it's been about 15 minutes and all 
you have to do is just try to cut into one with

a spoon and if it cuts easily like that you're 
good to go now I'm gonna show you a little trick

because now we're going to puree this however 
if you want to tone down the spiciness of this

hot sauce by removing the seeds instead of 
removing it in the beginning where it gets

pretty tedious there's an easier way so what I'm 
going to do is I'm going to use a slotted spoon

transfer the pulp into my blender jug here and 
by doing this I'm leaving quite a lot of seeds

at the bottom of the pot just going to pour the 
rest of the vinegar through the strainer and as

you can see it's going to catch a whole bunch 
of seeds so you've got really hot peppers this

is a really convenient way to get rid of excess 
heat that you don't want you can use whatever

kind of blender you have but I am gonna use my 
new toy my new massive stick blender off I go

and try not to stick your head directly 
above it because doesn't smell good right now

all right so just get it as smooth as you can and 
then I'm going to strain it through a strainer to

get it extra smooth now you're using one of those 
super blender like a Vitamix it may be completely

smooth by this point in which case you don't need 
to strain it you're going to need to use a rubber

spot to sort of force it through and just press on 
it ooh this looks so good and it would be easier

if the size of your strainer matches the size 
of your pot but alas once it looks pretty dry

once you think oh there can't possibly be anything 
else I just take a knife and I scrape the bottom

and there's always more that's just hanging on 
to the bottom and then if I press it again and

I scrape again there's always more coming out 
I know where it's all coming from I just keep

pressing and more just keeps coming out and you 
do this until you don't get any more sauce or

you run out of patience whichever comes first so 
you can imagine that if you have a really strong

blender and it blends everything it's going to 
be a light a little bit spicier because you're

getting more of the seeds in there the seasoning 
for this is super simple some salt and sugar now

it's going to look like I'm adding a lot of 
sugar but trust me because this right now it's

all vinegar and all chilies you need quite a bit 
of sugar to balance it out even though this isn't

going to taste prominently sweet I'm going to 
turn this back on to dissolve the sugar whoa ooh

the color is going to darken instantly because 
everybody's blenders are going to be different

you're going to end up with different amounts 
of stuff so you may need a little more sugar

a little more salt I'm going to give it a taste 
here we go I have no idea how spicy this will be

not bad it's spicy for sure but it's just 
right actually I really like that I will

add a little more sugar just a tablespoon 
now a seed right a sauce is plain and simple

like this it's pretty much done at this 
point it's just fine-tuning but if you

want to sort of kick it up a notch and 
add some spices you can add some cumin

and that'll give you a bit more of 
a Mexican flair to it one more taste

mmm-hmm okay that's exactly where I want it to be 
just the right amount of tartness spiciness and

sweetness a little sweetness to balance you won't 
really taste any saltiness the salt is just there

to season and balance the sauce as a whole mmm 
oh that looks good I have a couple recipes you

can use already you can use it on a Thai armlet 
one of my pad thai recipes actually uses si Racha

sauce and next week I am going to put up a awesome

is actually the reason why I made this because
